page.title: 14Mayfield Park
page.content: Mayfield Park was once the site of a large house which was the home of the Chamberlayne family. Most of the Eastern outskirts of Southampton belonged to the{Chamberlayne Estates. The house was demolished in the 1950s when it became unsafe. It had been used as a temperory home for displaced persons after the war. The actual house site is now a bowling green complete with club house and toilets.There are beautiful{formal {gardens,}enormous shady pine trees and good hiding places in the thick woods.There are swings,a climbing frame,a slide and a roundabout to play on.There is also a concrete skateboard track sweeping down the hill. A tall obelisk stands on top of the hill commemorating a horse.The old lodge house is still occupied and the stables are used as council storage.
